description: From German Schofel (“worthless stuff, rubbish”), substantive use of schofel (“base, mean, worthless”), representing the German-Jewish pronunciation of Hebrew שפל‎ (shāphēl, “low”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete, UK, slang, countable) A Hansom cab.

examples: To discover  […]  how the honest poor are compelled to hob-and-nob with the “shoful pitcher” and the “gun,” it is necessary to visit the vast nursery-grounds of crime.
